register.description: This register enables the DSS domain power state transition. It controls the HW supervised domain power state transition between ON-ACTIVE and ON-INACTIVE states. It also holds 1 status bit per clock input of the domain.

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the BB2D_GFCLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insesitive] Read 0x0: Corresponding clock is definitely gated Read 0x1: Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going

This field indicates the state of the HDMI_CEC_GFCLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive] Read 0x0: Corresponding clock is definitely gated Read 0x1: Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going
This field indicates the state of the HDMI_PHY_GFCLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the DSS_SYS_GFCLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the DSS_GFCLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the DSS_L3_GICLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going

bitfield.description: Controls the clock state transition of the DSS clock domain.

bitenum.description: NO_SLEEP: Sleep transition cannot be initiated. Wakeup transition may however occur.
SW_SLEEP: Start a software forced sleep transition on the domain.
SW_WKUP: Start a software forced wake-up transition on the domain.
HW_AUTO: Automatic transition is enabled. Sleep and wakeup transition are based upon hardware conditions.

register.description: This register controls the static domain depedencies from DSS domain towards 'target' domains. It is relevant only for domain having system initiator(s).

bitfield.description: Static dependency towards L3_MAIN2 clock domain
Static dependency towards L3_MAIN1 clock domain
Static dependency towards EMIF clock domain
Static dependency towards IVA clock domain

register.description: This register controls the dynamic domain depedencies from DSS domain towards 'target' domains. It is relevant only for domain having INTRCONN master port(s).

bitfield.description: Dynamic dependency towards L3_MAIN2 domain
Dynamic dependency towards L3_MAIN1 domain

register.description: This register manages the DSS clocks.

bitfield.description: Module standby status. [warm reset insensitive]
Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including INTRCONN
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in Idle mode (only INTRCONN part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: Optional functional clock control.
Optional functional clock control.
Optional functional clock control.
Optional functional clock control.
Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is disable by SW. Any INTRCONN access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is explicitly enabled. Interface clock (if not used for functions) may be gated according to the clock domain state. Functional clocks are guarantied to stay present. As long as in this configuration, power domain sleep transition cannot happen.

register.description: This register manages the DSS clocks.

bitfield.description: Module standby status. [warm reset insensitive]
Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including INTRCONN
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in Idle mode (only INTRCONN part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is disable by SW. Any INTRCONN access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is explicitly enabled. Interface clock (if not used for functions) may be gated according to the clock domain state. Functional clocks are guarantied to stay present. As long as in this configuration, power domain sleep transition cannot happen.
